required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Gait Modification Treatments for Knee Pathology
clinical_study.official_title: Analysis of Pain, Function, and Joint Mechanics in Response to Two Treatments for Knee Pathology

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is complete a longitudinal cross-over clinical study to investigate the effect of treatments for knee pathology, including cutaneous stimulation (skin vibration and soft knee brace), on locomotion tasks (i.e. walking, jogging, stair ascending and descending), muscle function, and pain/function.

study_design_info.masking_description: Participants will be told only that we are comparing two types of treatment for their knee pain.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Peak Knee Flexion Moment (%Bw*Ht)
primary_outcome.description: Within-subject change (follow-up - baseline) in peak knee flexion moment (%Bodyweight*Height) with the intervention at 4-week follow-up versus control (without the intervention) at baseline.

secondary_outcome.description: Within-subject change (follow-up - baseline) in pain (KOOS sub-scale) with the intervention at 4-weeks versus control (without the intervention) at baseline. KOOS scores are transformed to a 0-100 scale, with zero representing extreme knee problems and 100 representing no knee problems.

Within-subject change (follow-up - baseline) in function (KOOS sub-scale) with the intervention at 4-weeks versus control (without the intervention) at baseline. KOOS scores are transformed to a 0-100 scale, with zero representing extreme knee problems and 100 representing no knee problems.

Within-subject change (follow-up - baseline) in symptoms (KOOS sub-scale) with the intervention at 4-weeks versus control (without the intervention) at baseline. KOOS scores are transformed to a 0-100 scale, with zero representing extreme knee problems and 100 representing no knee problems.

arm_group.description: Subjects will receive two treatments: (1) a non-invasive external Cutaneous Stimulation device placed on the leg of the subject consisting of a sensing module to determine specific points in the gait cycle, a processor to analyze signal from the sensor, and a stimulus module to provide feedback (vibration) to the subject and (2) a commercially-available knee sleeve, separated by a washout period.

Subjects will receive two treatments: (1) a commercially-available knee sleeve and (2) a non-invasive external Cutaneous Stimulation device placed on the leg of the subject consisting of a sensing module to determine specific points in the gait cycle, a processor to analyze signal from the sensor, and a stimulus module to provide feedback (vibration) to the subject, separated by a washout period.

intervention.description: A non-invasive external device that will be placed on the leg of the subject. The device consists of a sensing module to determine specific points in the gait cycle, a processor to analyze signal from the sensor, and a stimulus module to provide feedback to the subject.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 18-80
- Ambulatory
- Symptomatic knee pain ≥ 3/10 on most of the past 30 days
- Prior ACL injury/surgery, meniscus injury/surgery, and/or physician-diagnosed medial compartment knee osteoarthritis (KL grade 1-3)
- Agreement and ability to use provided interventions during the study period (suggested cumulative wear time during walking of 1-2 hr/day)
- Committed to not starting any new therapies for knee condition during the trial, other than rescue pain medication.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Use of walking aid (e.g. cane, crutch, walker, or wheelchair)
- BMI ≥ 35 kg/m2
- Injection in the affected knee during the previous three months
- Known neuropathy due to diabetes or other causes
- Inability to provide informed consent

provided_document.document_type: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

group.title: Experimental Treatment A Then B
group.description: Subjects will receive two treatments: (1) a non-invasive external Cutaneous Stimulation device placed on the leg of the subject consisting of a sensing module to determine specific points in the gait cycle, a processor to analyze signal from the sensor, and a stimulus module to provide feedback (vibration) to the subject and (2) a commercially-available knee sleeve, separated by a washout period. Cutaneous Stimulation: A non-invasive external device that will be placed on the leg of the subject. The device consists of a sensing module to determine specific points in the gait cycle, a processor to analyze signal from the sensor, and a stimulus module to provide feedback to the subject. Knee Sleeve: Commercially-available Passive Knee Bands.

group.title: Experimental Treatment B Then A
group.description: Subjects will receive two treatments: (1) a commercially-available knee sleeve and (2) a non-invasive external Cutaneous Stimulation device placed on the leg of the subject consisting of a sensing module to determine specific points in the gait cycle, a processor to analyze signal from the sensor, and a stimulus module to provide feedback (vibration) to the subject, separated by a washout period. Cutaneous Stimulation: A non-invasive external device that will be placed on the leg of the subject. The device consists of a sensing module to determine specific points in the gait cycle, a processor to analyze signal from the sensor, and a stimulus module to provide feedback to the subject. Knee Sleeve: Commercially-available knee sleeve.

baseline.population: All participants entered into the study (all participants received both Treatments A and B in this cross-over study design)

group.title: All Participants
group.description: Subjects received two treatments assigned in random order: (1) a commercially-available knee sleeve and (2) a non-invasive external Cutaneous Stimulation device placed on the leg of the subject consisting of a sensing module to determine specific points in the gait cycle, a processor to analyze signal from the sensor, and a stimulus module to provide feedback (vibration) to the subject, separated by a washout period. Cutaneous Stimulation: A non-invasive external device that will be placed on the leg of the subject. The device consists of a sensing module to determine specific points in the gait cycle, a processor to analyze signal from the sensor, and a stimulus module to provide feedback to the subject. Knee Sleeve: Commercially-available knee sleeve.

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measure.title: Peak Knee Flexion Moment (%Bw*Ht)
measure.description: The peak knee flexion moment during stance phase of gait, collected during motion capture analysis at a self-selected normal walking speed. The peak knee flexion moment is normalized to percentage body weight and height (%Bw*Ht).

measure.title: KOOS Pain
measure.description: Pain subscale of the Knee Injury and Osteoarthritis Outcome Score (KOOS) questionnaire designed to assess short and long-term patient-relevant outcomes following knee injury. Scores are transformed to a 0-100 scale, with zero representing extreme knee problems and 100 representing no knee problems.

measure.title: KOOS Symptoms
measure.description: Symptom subscale of the Knee Injury and Osteoarthritis Outcome Score (KOOS) questionnaire designed to assess short and long-term patient-relevant outcomes following knee injury. Scores are transformed to a 0-100 scale, with zero representing extreme knee problems and 100 representing no knee problems.

measure.title: KOOS Function
measure.description: Function subscale of the Knee Injury and Osteoarthritis Outcome Score (KOOS) questionnaire designed to assess short and long-term patient-relevant outcomes following knee injury. Scores are transformed to a 0-100 scale, with zero representing extreme knee problems and 100 representing no knee problems.

outcome.title: Change in Peak Knee Flexion Moment (%Bw*Ht)
outcome.description: Within-subject change (follow-up - baseline) in peak knee flexion moment (%Bodyweight*Height) with the intervention at 4-week follow-up versus control (without the intervention) at baseline.

The device consists of a sensing module to determine specific points in the gait cycle, a processor to analyze signal from the sensor, and a stimulus module to provide feedback to the subject.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
